subject: Investing
title: Closed-End Funds for Income
description: A quick, practical guide to Closed-End Funds for Income.

hook.text: A fund trading at a 15% discount to its net asset value paid an 8% yield. The discount was the edge.

buildup.text: Closed-end funds issue a fixed number of shares that trade on an exchange, often at a premium or discount to NAV.

discovery.text: Many CEFs use leverage to boost income, generating yields of 7-12% from bonds, loans, or equities.

twist.text: Leverage amplifies gains in good times and losses in bad times. In 2020, some leveraged CEFs dropped over 40%.

climax.text: Buy CEFs at discounts to NAV with moderate leverage and solid distribution coverage for the best risk-reward.

punchline.text: CEFs are income machinesâ€”but read the leverage label before you buy.

quiz.question: What makes closed-end funds unique compared to ETFs?
options: They trade at premiums or discounts to net asset value
